este un care ssa te distrezi cu priteni
This game is garbage, I love it, and I'll probably continue feed BHVR more of my money.

This game is a ton of fun and I highly recommend it. The community is a unique one to say the least. The learning curve isn't steep and a couple of well utilized YouTube tutorials will put you ahead of the curve once you grasp the basics. If it ever gets stale you can switch from Killer to Survivor and back again and it's a completely different experience. It's almost like two games in one. The DLCs are awesome and what's nice is you get the base game for a lower price and then only buy the DLCs you want to use. The Shrine of Secrets allows you to get perks from DLCs without having to buy them or if you want to grind you can just outright earn the DLC characters in-game for free. Great game and I highly recommend it. Come join us in the fog.
Trotz der vielen Bugs mein absolutes lieblings game :)

Minus the sandbags from randoms lol. It's an even greater experience with friends (SWF). I personally main survivor and enjoy lopping the killer (when I manage to pull it off ofc ;) ), however, playing the killer as of recent is just as fun. The game does have it occasional bugs/glitches at times due to patch releases, however, its still fun and not game breaking. The ranking system is pretty decent when it works. 

A new revamped tutorial system for new players of dbd, which is easy to learn and actually informative about the game's mechanics this time around. 

Additionally, the content for the game is rich with new original and licensed characters we may all know and love, new perks, new or reworked maps, and fresh cosmetics being release with each new chapter. 

The dead by daylight community is vast with countless content creators so you can be up-to-date with the latest dbd content, and as well as to learn new skills, perks, features, etc. about the game. Vibrant community. 

Overall Dead by Daylight is a solid game in my book and is very fun to get play. Hope this review may help any newcomer of DBD.

This is the super smash bros of Horror games. They manage to get famous horror movie icons into their game, and you get to play as them!

Which is very weird because this game has some of the worst, most incompetent game devs I have ever seen in any video game ever in my life, and I have no idea how they managed to pull off all these deals with famous movie and game companies.

For the amount of time I have put into this game, the money I have spent, and the nights it has kept me up sad and frustrated. It's just too late to go back now

10/10 I think we have done a pretty good job so far.

I love playing this game and would definitely recommend it to others. Its fun and thrilling and it is a great game whether you want to play as a survivor or a killer.

This game is the best thing you'll be able to find when it comes to multiplayer horror, offering insane variety that after thousands of hours you would never be able to tell if you ever played the same round twice, because you definitely wouldn't. 
   The community around it is definitely a more toxic community, and there'll be those times you run into that part of the community in-game and it'll most likely be the most miserable you've ever been in the game, but there are also the times where you play with the best kinds of people that make you glad you decided to play that day.
   The game has a lot of pay-to-unlock, but also offers in-game ways to unlock a lot of the content, at least for the non-licensed characters. 
   It becomes a bit of a time passer, and even if after a thousand hours you get old of it, this game gave you a thousand hours of entertainment for 20$ (or so), and that sounds like a deal. There's also plenty of videos online to show you what makes the game worth playing as well as tutorials for if you want to get into it, so if the trailers, licensed characters, or community weren't enough to sway you over, I recommend checking those out to see if you'd enjoy it, but i'd say you most likely will.
